lclpy.problem package¶

Submodules¶

lclpy.problem.abstract_local_search_problem module¶

class lclpy.problem.abstract_local_search_problem.AbstractLocalSearchProblem¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Template to create Problem-classes for localsearch implemenatations.

This Class is meant to be used as a template. It is supposed to be used when constructing your own solution objects for a specific problem.

abstract evaluate()¶

Evaluates the current state of the solution.

Returns

An indication of the quality of the current state.

Return type

int or float

evaluate_move(move)¶

Evaluates the quality gained or lost by a potential move.

This function does not need to be implemented.

Parameters

move (tuple of int) – Represents a unique valid move.

Returns

The change in value of the eval-function if the move is performed.

Return type

int or float

first_neighbourhood()¶

Changes the current neighbourhood to the first neighbourhood.

Note that this function will only be useable if the neighbourhood given to the constructor is a MultiNeighbourhood.

Raises

WrongMoveTypeError – If the move_function isn’t a MultiNeighbourhood.

abstract get_moves()¶

An iterable that returns all valid moves in the complete neighbourhood.

Yields

move (tuple of int) – A representation of the next move in the neighbourhood.

abstract get_random_move()¶

A function to return a random move from the complete neighbourhood.

Returns

A representation of the move.

Return type

tuple of int

abstract move(move)¶

Performs a move.

Parameters

move (tuple of int) – A representation of a move.

next_neighbourhood()¶

Changes the current neighbourhood to the next neighbourhood.

Note that this function will only be useable if the neighbourhood given to the constructor is a MultiNeighbourhood. If this function is called when the last neighbourhood is the current neighbourhood, the last neighbourhood will remain the current neighbourhood and an exception will be raised.

Raises

  • NoNextNeighbourhood – If there is no next neighbourhood. This is simply an indication that the current neighbourhood was the last neighbourhood.

  • WrongMoveTypeError – If the move_function isn’t a MultiNeighbourhood.

previous_neighbourhood()¶

Changes the current neighbourhood to the previous neighbourhood.

Note that this function will only be useable if the neighbourhood given to the constructor is a MultiNeighbourhood. If this function is called when the first neighbourhood is the current neighbourhood, the first neighbourhood will remain the current neighbourhood.

Raises

WrongMoveTypeError – If the move_function isn’t a MultiNeighbourhood.

abstract reset()¶

Resets the object back to it’s state after init.

select_get_moves()¶

Function to get all moves from the current neighbourhood.

Note that this function will only be useable if the neighbourhood given to the constructor is a MultiNeighbourhood.

Returns

An iterable generator object that contains all the moves of the current neighbourhood.

Return type

generator

Raises

WrongMoveTypeError – If the move_function isn’t a MultiNeighbourhood.

select_random_move()¶

A method used to generate a random move from the current neighbourhood.

Note that this function will only be useable if the neighbourhood given to the constructor is a MultiNeighbourhood.

Returns

A random valid move from the current neighbourhood.

Return type

tuple of int

Raises

WrongMoveTypeError – If the move_function isn’t a MultiNeighbourhood.

abstract set_as_best()¶

Saves the current state as the best found state.

abstract state()¶

Returns an immutable hashable object that describes the current state.

Returns

A representation of the current state.

Return type

tuple

abstract undo_move(move)¶

Undoes a move.

Parameters

move (tuple of int) – A representation of the move one wishes to undo.

lclpy.problem.array_problem module¶

class lclpy.problem.array_problem.ArrayProblem(evaluation_function, move_function, size, order=None)¶

Bases: lclpy.problem.abstract_local_search_problem.AbstractLocalSearchProblem

Contains all the data needed to handle a problem.

Parameters

  • evaluation_function (AbstractEvaluationFunction) – The evaluation function that needs to be used for the problem.

  • move_function (AbstractMove) – The move function that needs to be used for the problem.

  • order (numpy.ndarray or list, optional) – A one dimensional array that contains the order of the points to start with. All values are int, unique and are within the interval [0,size[. The default value is None. In the default case a numpy array will be generated. The generated array’s values will always be ordered from small to big.

_evaluation_function¶

The evaluation function that is used for the problem

Type

AbstractEvaluationFunction.

_move_function¶

The move function that is used for the problem.

Type

AbstractMove

_order¶

A 1 dimensional array that contains the current order of the points. All values are int, unique and are within the interval [0,size[.

Type

numpy.ndarray

_starting_order¶

The initial value of _order.

Type

numpy.ndarray

best_order¶

Contains the order of the best found problem.

Type

numpy.ndarray

best_order_value¶

The evaluation value of the best found problem.

Type

int or float

Examples

A simple example, demonstrates the use of move, undo_move, evaluate and set_as_best. Note that problem.set_as_best_order does NOT check if the value actually belongs to the order NOR does it check if the value is better than the previous best value:

Initialising with a non-default order:

evaluate()¶

A function to evaluate the current _order.

Returns

An evaluation of the current state of _order.

Return type

int or float

evaluate_move(move)¶

Evaluates the quality gained or lost by a potential move.

Can lead to considerable speedups. Is equivalent to a delta evaluation between _order and _order after the move is performed. Note that delta-evaluation needs to be implemented for the evaluation function and the move type for this method to work.

Parameters

move (tuple of int) – Represents a unique valid move.

Returns

The change in value of the eval-function if the move is performed.

Return type

int or float

Examples

A simple example:

first_neighbourhood()¶

Changes the current neighbourhood to the first neighbourhood.

Note that this function will only be useable if the neighbourhood given to the constructor is a MultiNeighbourhood.

Raises

WrongMoveTypeError – If the move_function isn’t a MultiNeighbourhood.

get_moves()¶

An iterable that returns all valid moves in the complete neighbourhood.

Yields

tuple of int – The next move in the neighbourhood.

Examples

Gets all moves from the neigbourhood, you should NEVER do this. You should evaluate only one move at a time. This example is simply to show the behaviour of get_moves.

get_random_move()¶

A function to return a random move from the complete neighbourhood.

Returns

Represents one unique valid move in the neighbourhood.

Return type

tuple of int

Examples

Get a random valid move:

move(move)¶

Performs a move on _order.

Parameters

move_number (tuple of int) – Represents a unique valid move.

next_neighbourhood()¶

Changes the current neighbourhood to the next neighbourhood.

Note that this function will only be useable if the neighbourhood given to the constructor is a MultiNeighbourhood. If this function is called when the last neighbourhood is the current neighbourhood, the last neighbourhood will remain the current neighbourhood and an exception will be raised.

Raises

  • NoNextNeighbourhood – If there is no next neighbourhood. This is simply an indication that the current neighbourhood was the last neighbourhood.

  • WrongMoveTypeError – If the move_function isn’t a MultiNeighbourhood.

previous_neighbourhood()¶

Changes the current neighbourhood to the previous neighbourhood.

Note that this function will only be useable if the neighbourhood given to the constructor is a MultiNeighbourhood. If this function is called when the first neighbourhood is the current neighbourhood, the first neighbourhood will remain the current neighbourhood.

Raises

WrongMoveTypeError – If the move_function isn’t a MultiNeighbourhood.

reset()¶

Resets the object back to it’s state after init.

_order is replaced by a copy of _starting_order.

Examples

A simple example with the default order:

An example with a non-default order:

Raises

set_as_best(evaluation_value)¶

Sets the current _order as the new best_order

Parameters

evaluation_value (int or float) – The evaluation value of the current order. If you haven’t kept or calculated said value, it can always be calculated with evaluate(). The recalculation will take time, however.

state()¶

Returns an immutable hashable object that describes the current state.

Returns

A hashable object associated with the current state.

Return type

tuple

Examples

A simple example:

undo_move(move)¶

Undoes a move on _order .

Parameters

move_number (tuple of int) – Represents a unique valid move.

Module contents¶

This package contains a template class for Problems and implementations of said class.
